metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5581 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the ModifiablePixelBuffer::fillRect function in TigerVNC before 1.7.1 allows remote servers to execute arbitrary code via an RRE message with subrectangle outside framebuffer boundaries.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5581` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tigervnc-common - 1.7.0+dfsg-8ubuntu2
tigervnc-scraping-server - 1.7.0+dfsg-8ubuntu2
tigervnc-standalone-server - 1.7.0+dfsg-8ubuntu2
tigervnc-viewer - 1.7.0+dfsg-8ubuntu2
tigervnc-xorg-extension - 1.7.0+dfsg-8ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tigervnc package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.7.0+dfsg-8ubuntu2').
